metadata.config_description: Base configuration for the pipeline using previous best performers

variant_extraction.description: Regex-based variant extraction with BioC supplement integration

associations.explanation: The study focused on CARD8 rs2043211 and NLRP3 rs4612666; no data were provided for rs35829419.
citations: CARD8 (rs2043211) and NLRP3 (rs4612666) were genotyped using Agilent, AriaMx, USA, through Tri-Plex SYBR Green-based real-time PCR allelic discrimination assays.
NLRP3 SNP rs4612666 and CARD8 SNP rs2043211 were examined in RA patients and healthy controls to determine their morbid genotypes and alleles.
Second, we investigated only two NLRP3 inflammasome polymorphisms, more SNPs should be assessed.

associations.sentence: Genotypes TC + CC of rs4612666 are associated with decreased likelihood of response to anti–TNF-α therapy (infliximab or etanercept) and increased disease activity (higher DAS-28, TNF-α and IL-1β) in people with Rheumatoid Arthritis in Iraq as compared to genotype TT; association was statistically significant after 3 months of treatment.
associations.explanation: In a cohort of 100 Iraqi RA patients followed for 3 months on infliximab or etanercept, carriers of the NLRP3 rs4612666 variant allele had significantly higher DAS-28 and cytokine levels and a lower EULAR response versus non-carriers.
citations: Also, NLRP3 (rs4612666) TT genotype was more frequent in patients with higher DAS-28 (P < 0.0001) and higher TNF-α and IL- 1β serum levels (P < 0.0001 for both).

Moreover, NLRP3 (rs4612666), C Allele bearing genotypes (wild homozygous and heterozygous genotypes) are associated with lower DAS-28 as compared with T allele bearing genotypes (Variant homozygous and heterozygous genotypes (P < 0.0001 and 0.003 respectively), this supposing that NLRP3 (rs4612666) variant genotypes are extremely associated with higher disease progression and lower response to anti-TNF-α drugs.

Recessive model of NLRP3 (rs4612666) was associated with higher TNF-α and IL- 1β serum level after 3 months of treatment (P = 0.002 and P < 0.0001 respectively), where T allele bearing genotypes (Variant homozygous and heterozygous) were significantly associated with higher cytokines level.
Significant difference was observed in CARD8 (rs2043211) genotypes between responders and non-responders (P < 0.0001). As well as, NLRP3 genotypes (rs4612666) (P < 0.0001).
CARD8 rs2043211 and NLRP3 rs4612666 variant polymorphisms are associated with high serum TNF-α and IL-1β, active disease course, poor disease outcomes, and low response to anti-TNF-α therapy.

associations.sentence: Genotypes AT + TT of rs2043211 are associated with decreased likelihood of response to anti–TNF-α therapy (infliximab or etanercept) and increased disease activity (higher DAS-28, TNF-α and IL-1β) in people with Rheumatoid Arthritis in Iraq as compared to genotype AA; association was statistically significant after 3 months of treatment.
associations.explanation: Among 100 Iraqi RA patients assessed after 3 months of anti–TNF-α therapy, CARD8 rs2043211 T-allele carriers—especially TT—showed significantly higher DAS-28 and cytokines and poorer EULAR response compared with AA homozygotes.
citations: CARD8 (rs2043211) TT genotype was more frequent in patients with higher DAS-28 (P < 0.0001) and higher TNF-α and IL-1β serum levels (P < 0.0001 for both).
Significant difference was observed in CARD8 (rs2043211) genotypes between responders and non-responders (P < 0.0001).
This assume that CARD8 (rs2043211) variant genotypes are associated with lower response to anti-TNF-α treatments in RA patients.

Higher response rate associated with dominant models of CARD8 SNP rs2043211 and NLRP3 SNP rs4612666 (P < 0.0001 and 0.001 respectively). While highly non response rate related with recessive models of these two SNPs (P < 0.0001 for both).

Comparing SNPs models reveal that lower TNF-α and IL- 1β serum level after 3 months of treatment were associated with dominant models of CARD8 (rs2043211) SNPs (P < 0.0001 for both), while higher cytokines level associated with recessive model (P < 0.0001 for both).

result.summary:
## Background
- Study population: 100 Iraqi patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) treated with infliximab or etanercept for 3 months, and 100 healthy controls.
- Genes/SNPs examined: CARD8 rs2043211 (A>T) and NLRP3 rs4612666 (C>T), both involved in NLRP3 inflammasome regulation.
- Outcomes: RA susceptibility, disease activity (DAS-28), serum TNF-α and IL-1β, and response to anti–TNF-α therapy.

## Key Findings
- No RA susceptibility signal: Genotype and allele frequencies for CARD8 rs2043211 and NLRP3 rs4612666 did not differ significantly between patients and controls (P=0.17/0.059 and P=0.08/0.879, respectively).
- Strong pharmacogenomic associations with anti–TNF-α response:
  - CARD8 rs2043211:
    - TT genotype associated with higher disease activity and cytokines: DAS-28 4.65±0.65; TNF-α 14.25±4.67 pg/mL; IL-1β 4.55±0.64 pg/mL (all P<0.0001 across genotypes).
    - Markedly lower response rate: responders 1/16 (6%) for TT vs 32/37 (86%) for AA; genotype–response association P<0.0001.
  - NLRP3 rs4612666:
    - TT genotype associated with higher disease activity and cytokines: DAS-28 4.72±0.55; TNF-α 14.74±4.61 pg/mL; IL-1β 4.86±0.50 pg/mL (all P<0.0001 across genotypes).
    - Markedly lower response rate: responders 1/11 (9%) for TT vs 41/47 (87%) for CC; genotype–response association P<0.0001.
  - Genetic model analyses supported worse outcomes for T-allele–bearing genotypes at both loci (dominant/recessive models, P≤0.003), with strong odds ratios for non-response (e.g., CARD8 dominant model OR ~0.02; 95% CI ~0.002–0.16; NLRP3 models also significant).
- Biomarker correlations: Higher TNF-α and IL-1β correlated with higher DAS-28 (r2=0.45 and 0.51; both P<0.0001) and with non-response (TNF-α 13.68 vs 4.83 pg/mL; IL-1β 3.36 vs 1.57 pg/mL; both P<0.0001).

## Clinical Implications
- CARD8 rs2043211 and NLRP3 rs4612666 T-allele genotypes (especially TT) identify RA patients at high risk for poor response to infliximab or etanercept and for persistently high inflammatory activity.
- These variants were not associated with RA risk in this cohort, but have potential as pharmacogenomic biomarkers to guide expectations for anti–TNF-α therapy and to consider early alternative/adjunctive strategies (e.g., switching mechanism, tighter monitoring).
- Elevated baseline or on-treatment TNF-α/IL-1β levels align with poor response and may complement genotyping in predicting outcomes.
- Practical note: Findings are from a single-center Iraqi cohort with modest sample size; validation in larger, diverse populations is needed before routine clinical implementation.
